articles.headline: Justices, 5-4, Tell California to Cut Prisoner Population
articles.snippet: Conditions in overcrowded prisons violate the ban on cruel and unusual punishment, the Supreme Court ruled.
articles.abstract: Conditions in overcrowded prisons violate the ban on cruel and unusual punishment, the Supreme Court ruled.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Conditions in California’s overcrowded prisons are so bad that they violate the Eighth Amendment’s ban on cruel and unusual punishment, the Supreme Court ruled on Monday, ordering the state to reduce its prison population by more than 30,000 inmates.

articles.headline: In Europe, Rifts Widen Over Greece
articles.snippet: Fissures among Europe’s currency partners are deepening, raising new doubts about whether the group can resolve a regional debt crisis.
articles.abstract: Fissures among Europe’s currency partners are deepening, raising new doubts about whether the group can resolve a regional debt crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Fissures among Europe’s currency partners are becoming even deeper and more widespread than was previously evident, raising new doubts about whether the group can resolve the regional debt crisis that has simmered for more than a year.

articles.headline: Recall Study Finds Flaws at Toyota
articles.snippet: A panel cites a tendency to dismiss customer complaints and a lack of a clear procedure for handling safety problems.
articles.abstract: A panel cites a tendency to dismiss customer complaints and a lack of a clear procedure for handling safety problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Toyota’s tendency to dismiss customer complaints and lack of a clear procedure for handling safety problems were among flaws identified Monday by a panel investigating the automaker’s recalls of more than 14 million vehicles because of problems that included acceleration and floor mats.

articles.headline: In Airline Gift Bags, a Chance to Sell
articles.snippet: The amenity bag given to premium-class travelers not only reflects the airline’s brand but also demonstrates high regard for top customers.
articles.abstract: The amenity bag given to premium-class travelers not only reflects the airline’s brand but also demonstrates high regard for top customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The little amenity bags given to premium-class travelers hold an oversize importance to the airlines: they not only reflect the airline’s brand, but also demonstrate the carriers’ high regard for top customers.

articles.headline: Union Effort Turns Its Focus to Target
articles.snippet: The retailer’s employees are unhappy about low wages and short workweeks.
articles.abstract: The retailer’s employees are unhappy about low wages and short workweeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the world of big-box discounters, Target enjoys a reputation as a model corporate citizen that sells the latest in cheap chic. That’s a sharp contrast to the image of Wal-Mart, the world’s largest retailer, which labor unions have pilloried for years, accusing it of providing skimpy wages and benefits and skirting various labor laws.

articles.headline: A Slice of Afghanistan Well Secured by Afghans
articles.snippet: In Zabul Province, the Afghan Army and the police are emerging as authorities acceptable to local people, providing a glimpse of a secure future.
articles.abstract: In Zabul Province, the Afghan Army and the police are emerging as authorities acceptable to local people, providing a glimpse of a secure future.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHINKAY, Afghanistan — Zabul Province, one of Afghanistan’s poorest, is mainly known for being a transit route for Taliban insurgents and NATO supply convoys.

articles.headline: At Well-Paying Law Firms, a Low-Paid Corner
articles.snippet: It’s almost a form of in-country outsourcing: lawyers doing high-value work in small American cities, but for far less than partner-track pay.
articles.abstract: It’s almost a form of in-country outsourcing: lawyers doing high-value work in small American cities, but for far less than partner-track pay.
articles.lead_paragraph: WHEELING, W.Va. — The nation’s biggest law firms are creating a second tier of workers, stripping pay and prestige from one of the most coveted jobs in the business world.

articles.headline: Egypt Is Moving to Try Mubarak in Fatal Protests
articles.snippet: Former President Hosni Mubarak will be tried for conspiring to kill protesters, Egypt’s top prosecutor announced, yielding to demands for accountability.
articles.abstract: Former President Hosni Mubarak will be tried for conspiring to kill protesters, Egypt’s top prosecutor announced, yielding to demands for accountability.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Former President Hosni Mubarak will be put on trial for conspiring to kill unarmed protesters, Egypt’s top prosecutor announced Tuesday, yielding to public demands for accountability and setting an example that could rattle autocrats around the region.
